result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E Donnell Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Cts 1 & 3 in 14CF749 and Consecutive to Ct 2 in 14CF749.
Court will consider deft for expunction at conclusion of both files if he completes probation successfully.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

superMiscConds.notes: Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges - ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS ARE NOW A CIVIL JUDGMENT.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

9/3/15 - Motion Hearing
*Filed in 14-CF-1398.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Celebre.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 1 is dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived due to a recent PSI being completed in file 14CF749.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions concurrent to cts 1 & 3 in 14CF749 and consecutive to ct 2 in 14CF749; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.  No contact w/felons.  Court will consider deft for expunction at conclusion of both files if he completes probation successfully.
Per Atty Celebre the case is resolved, with Atty Celebre and ADA McNeill a PLEAH is set for 12/7/16 at 1:15pm; the FPT of 12/15/16 at 1:30pm and JS of 2/27/17 at 8:30am are removed from the calendar.

Defendant, Charles E Donnell, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Amy Schneider.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Def. failed to report to P&P for the PSI.  Jury trial requested by def.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for February 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Atty Celebre states he was unable to reach DE for court today so DE is only aware of the hearing in his other case so he is requesting this case be set over with other case.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
With Atty Celebre a STC is set for 7/21/16 8:30am; Atty Celebre to send notice to deft if he is unable to reach him today.

Chief John Morrissey present.  Atty Celebre's motion for discovery.  Court grants motion for en camera inspection.  Court forfeits bond and issues warrant $5,000 cash bond.  Atty Celebre states he received a message that the deft is en route from his home.  Court has conference off the record with Atty Knight and Police Chief John Morrissey for en camera inspection.
